snippet: The adventuresome Juilliard Opera fashioned a fascinating double bill from two disparate English operas that proved complementary in less than obvious ways.
abstract: Steve Smith reviews Juilliard Opera production of one-act operas Curlew River, by Benjamin Britten, and Riders to the Sea, by Vaughan Williams, directed by John Giampietro and starring Kyle Bielfeld and Lacey Jo Benter.
lead_paragraph: The adventuresome Juilliard Opera fashioned a fascinating double bill from two disparate English operas that proved complementary in less than obvious ways.

headline.seo: Juilliard Opera’s ‘Curlew River’ and ‘Riders to the Sea’
